2. He has half as many quarters as dimes.

According to the first relationship, the number of dimes is twice the number of nickels, so dimes would be \( 2n \).

The second relationship says he has half as many quarters as dimes, so quarters would be \( \frac{1}{2} \times 2n = n \).
